options.title: animation
options.demo: Updating with no animation, with a longer duration, with a jQuery UI easing.
options.name: chart--animation
options.description:
Set the overall animation for all chart updating. Animation can be disabled throughout the chart by setting it to false here. It can be overridden for each individual API method as a function parameter. The only animation not affected by this option is the initial series animation, see plotOptions.series.animation.

The animation can either be set as a boolean or a configuration object. If true, it will use the 'swing' jQuery easing and a duration of 500 ms. If used as a configuration object, the following properties are supported:

duration
The duration of the animation in milliseconds.
easing
When using jQuery as the general framework, the easing can be set to linear or swing. More easing functions are available with the use of jQuery plug-ins, most notably the jQuery UI suite. See the jQuery docs. When using MooTools as the general framework, use the property name transition instead of easing.

options.title: animation
options.name: legend-navigation--animation
options.description: How to animate the pages when navigating up or down. A value of true applies the default navigation given in the chart.animation option. Additional options can be given as an object containing values for easing and duration. .

options.title: animation
options.demo: Animation disabled, slower animation, easing "easeOutBounce" through jQuery UI.
options.name: plotOptions-series--animation
options.description:
Enable or disable the initial animation when a series is displayed. The animation can also be set as a configuration object. Please note that this option only applies to the initial animation of the series itself. For other animations, see chart.animation and the animation parameter under the API methods. The following properties are supported:

duration
The duration of the animation in milliseconds.
easing
When using jQuery as the general framework, the easing can be set to linear or swing. More easing functions are available with the use of jQuery plug-ins, most notably the jQuery UI suite. See the jQuery docs. When using MooTools as the general framework, use the property name transition instead of easing.

Due to poor performance, animation is disabled in old IE browsers for column charts and polar charts.

options.title: animation
options.name: tooltip--animation
options.description: Enable or disable animation of the tooltip. In slow legacy IE browsers the animation is disabled by default.

options.title: animation
options.name: drilldown--animation
options.description:
Set the animation for all drilldown animations. Animation of a drilldown occurs when drilling between a column point and a column series, or a pie slice and a full pie series. Drilldown can still be used between series and points of different types, but animation will not occur.

The animation can either be set as a boolean or a configuration object. If true, it will use the 'swing' jQuery easing and a duration of 500 ms. If used as a configuration object, the following properties are supported:

duration
The duration of the animation in milliseconds.
easing
When using jQuery as the general framework, the easing can be set to linear or swing. More easing functions are available with the use of jQuery plug-ins, most notably the jQuery UI suite. See the jQuery docs. When using MooTools as the general framework, use the property name transition instead of easing.

options.description:
Fires when a point is clicked. The this keyword refers to the point object itself. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. This contains common event information based on jQuery or MooTools depending on which library is used as the base for Highcharts.

If the series.allowPointSelect option is true, the default action for the point's click event is to toggle the point's select state. Returning false cancels this action.

options.title: click
options.demo: Alert coordinates on click. Alternatively, attach event to container
options.name: chart-events--click
options.description:
Fires when clicking on the plot background. The this keyword refers to the chart object itself. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. This contains common event information based on jQuery or MooTools depending on which library is used as the base for Highcharts.

Information on the clicked spot can be found through event.xAxis and event.yAxis, which are arrays containing the axes of each dimension and each axis' value at the clicked spot. The primary axes are event.xAxis[0] and event.yAxis[0]. Remember the unit of a datetime axis is milliseconds since 1970-01-01 00:00:00.

click: function(e) {
	console.log(
		Highcharts.dateFormat('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S', e.xAxis[0].value), 
		e.yAxis[0].value
	)
}

An array containing the default colors for the chart's series. When all colors are used, new colors are pulled from the start again. Defaults to:

   '#f15c80', '#e4d354', '#8085e8', '#8d4653', '#91e8e1']
Default colors can also be set on a series or series.type basis, see column.colors, pie.colors.

Legacy

In Highcharts 3.x, the default colors were: 

colors: ['#2f7ed8', '#0d233a', '#8bbc21', '#910000', '#1aadce', 
   '#492970', '#f28f43', '#77a1e5', '#c42525', '#a6c96a']

In Highcharts 2.x, the default colors were: 

colors: ['#4572A7', '#AA4643', '#89A54E', '#80699B', '#3D96AE', 
   '#DB843D', '#92A8CD', '#A47D7C', '#B5CA92']

options.title: cropThreshold
options.name: plotOptions-column--cropThreshold
options.description: When the series contains less points than the crop threshold, all points are drawn,  event if the points fall outside the visible plot area at the current zoom. The advantage of drawing all points (including markers and columns), is that animation is performed on updates. On the other hand, when the series contains more points than the crop threshold, the series data is cropped to only contain points that fall within the plot area. The advantage of cropping away invisible points is to increase performance on large series.  .

options.title: cropThreshold
options.name: plotOptions-series--cropThreshold
options.description: When the series contains less points than the crop threshold, all points are drawn,  event if the points fall outside the visible plot area at the current zoom. The advantage of drawing all points (including markers and columns), is that animation is performed on updates. On the other hand, when the series contains more points than the crop threshold, the series data is cropped to only contain points that fall within the plot area. The advantage of cropping away invisible points is to increase performance on large series.  .

options.title: crosshairs
options.demo: Enable a crosshair for the x value; true two-dimensional crosshairs; customized crosshairs; dotted crosshair for x axis.
options.name: tooltip--crosshairs
options.description:
Display crosshairs to connect the points with their corresponding axis values. The crosshairs can be defined as a boolean, an array of booleans or an object.
Boolean
If the crosshairs option is true, a single crosshair relating to the x axis will be shown.
Array of booleans
In an array of booleans, the first value turns on the x axis crosshair and the second value to the y axis crosshair. Use [true, true] to show complete crosshairs.
Array of objects
In an array of objects, the first value applies to the x axis crosshair and the second value to the y axis crosshair. For each dimension, a width, color, dashStyle and zIndex can be given.
Defaults to null.

  • 2a) arrays of numeric x and y
  • 2b) arrays of datetime x and y
  • 2c) arrays of point.name and y
  • 3) config objects
  • 4) 3D column with null values
options.name: series-data
options.description:
An array of data points for the series. The points can be given in three ways:
  1. An array of numerical values. In this case, the numerical values will be interpreted as y values, and x values will be automatically calculated, either starting at 0 and incrementing by 1, or from pointStart and pointInterval given in the plotOptions. If the axis is has categories, these will be used. This option is not available for range series. Example: 
    data: [0, 5, 3, 5]

  2. An array of arrays with two values. In this case, the first value is the x value and the second is the y value. If the first value is a string, it is applied as the name of the point, and the x value is incremented following the above rules.

    For range series, the arrays will be interpreted as [x, low, high]. In this cases, the X value can be skipped altogether to make use of pointStart and pointRange.

    Example: 
    data: [[5, 2], [6, 3], [8, 2]]

  3. An array of objects with named values. In this case the objects are point configuration objects as seen below.

    Range series values are given by low and high.

    Example: 
    data: [{
	name: 'Point 1',
	color: '#00FF00',
	y: 0
}, {
	name: 'Point 2',
	color: '#FF00FF',
	y: 5
}]

Note that line series and derived types like spline and area, require data to be sorted by X because it interpolates mouse coordinates for the tooltip. Column and scatter series, where each point has its own mouse event, does not require sorting.

Defaults to: 

{

    minute:"%A, %b %e, %H:%M",
    hour:"%A, %b %e, %H:%M",
    day:"%A, %b %e, %Y",
    week:"Week from %A, %b %e, %Y",

    year:"%Y"
}

options.title: formatter
options.demo: Simple string formatting, formatting with shared tooltip
options.name: tooltip--formatter
options.description:
Callback function to format the text of the tooltip. Return false to disable tooltip for a specific point on series.

A subset of HTML is supported. The HTML of the tooltip is parsed and converted to SVG, therefore this isn't a complete HTML renderer. The following tabs are supported: <b>, <strong>, <i>, <em>, <br/>, <span>. Spans can be styled with a style attribute, but only text-related CSS that is shared with SVG is handled.

Since version 2.1 the tooltip can be shared between multiple series through the shared option. The available data in the formatter differ a bit depending on whether the tooltip is shared or not. In a shared tooltip, all properties except x, which is common for all points, are kept in an array, this.points.

Available data are:

this.percentage (not shared) / this.points[i].percentage (shared)
Stacked series and pies only. The point's percentage of the total.
this.point (not shared) / this.points[i].point (shared)
The point object. The point name, if defined, is available through this.point.name.
this.points
In a shared tooltip, this is an array containing all other properties for each point.
this.series (not shared) / this.points[i].series (shared)
The series object. The series name is available through this.series.name.
this.total (not shared) / this.points[i].total (shared)
Stacked series only. The total value at this point's x value.
this.x
The x value. This property is the same regardless of the tooltip being shared or not.
this.y (not shared) / this.points[i].y (shared)
The y value.

options.title: formatter
options.name: xAxis-labels--formatter

options.title: formatter
options.demo: Added units to stack total value
options.name: yAxis-stackLabels--formatter

options.title: formatter
options.name: plotOptions-series-dataLabels--formatter
options.description:
Callback JavaScript function to format the data label. Note that if a format is defined, the format takes precedence and the formatter is ignored. Available data are:
this.percentage Stacked series and pies only. The point's percentage of the total.
this.point The point object. The point name, if defined, is available through this.point.name.
this.series: The series object. The series name is available through this.series.name.
this.total Stacked series only. The total value at this point's x value.
this.x: The x value.
this.y: The y value.

options.description: Callback function to format each of the series' labels. The this keyword refers to the series object, or the point object in case of pie charts. By default the series or point name is printed.

options.title: labelStyle
options.name: loading--labelStyle
options.description: CSS styles for the loading label span.

options.title: labels
options.name: labels
options.description: HTML labels that can be positioned anywhere in the chart area.

options.title: labels
options.name: xAxis-labels
options.description: The axis labels show the number or category for each tick.

options.title: lang
options.name: lang

options.title: layout
options.name: legend--layout
options.description: The layout of the legend items. Can be one of "horizontal" or "vertical".

options.title: legend
options.name: legend
options.description:
The legend is a box containing a symbol and name for each series item
	or point item in the chart.

options.title: legendIndex
options.name: series--legendIndex
options.description:
The sequential index of the series in the legend.
Try it: Legend in opposite order
.

options.title: legendIndex
options.name: series-data--legendIndex
options.description: Pies only. The sequential index of the pie slice in the legend.			.

options.title: legendItemClick
options.name: plotOptions-pie-events--legendItemClick
options.description: Not applicable to pies, as the legend item is per point. See point.events.

options.title: legendItemClick
options.name: plotOptions-pie-point-events--legendItemClick
options.description: Fires when the legend item belonging to the pie point (slice) is clicked. The this keyword refers to the point itself. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. This contains common event information based on jQuery or MooTools depending on which library is used as the base for Highcharts. The default action is to toggle the visibility of the point. This can be prevented by calling event.preventDefault().

options.title: legendItemClick
options.name: plotOptions-series-events--legendItemClick
options.description: Fires when the legend item belonging to the series is clicked. The this keyword refers to the series object itself. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. This contains common event information based on jQuery or MooTools depending on which library is used as the base for Highcharts. The default action is to toggle the visibility of the series. This can be prevented by returning false or calling event.preventDefault().

options.title: lineColor
options.name: plotOptions-area--lineColor
options.description: A separate color for the graph line. By default the line takes the color of the series, but the lineColor setting allows setting a separate color for the line without altering the fillColor.

options.title: lineColor
options.name: plotOptions-series-marker--lineColor
options.description: The color of the point marker's outline. When null, the series' or point's color is used.

options.title: lineColor
options.demo: White fill color, black line color
options.name: plotOptions-series-marker-states-hover--lineColor
options.description: The color of the point marker's outline. When null, the series' or point's color is used.

options.title: lineColor
options.demo: Red line color for selected points
options.name: plotOptions-series-marker-states-select--lineColor
options.description: The color of the point marker's outline. When null, the series' or point's color is used.

options.title: lineColor
options.name: plotOptions-waterfall--lineColor
options.description: The color of the line that connects columns in a waterfall series.

options.title: lineColor
options.demo: A red line on Y axis
options.name: xAxis--lineColor
options.description: The color of the line marking the axis itself.

options.title: lineHeight
options.name: legend--lineHeight
options.description: Line height for the legend items. Deprecated as of 2.1. Instead, the line height for each  item can be set using itemStyle.lineHeight, and the padding between items using itemMarginTop and itemMarginBottom.

options.title: lineWidth
options.name: plotOptions-arearange--lineWidth
options.description: Pixel width of the arearange graph line.

options.title: lineWidth
options.demo: Box plot styling, error bar styling
options.name: plotOptions-boxplot--lineWidth
options.description: The width of the line surrounding the box. If any of stemWidth, medianWidth or whiskerWidth are null, the lineWidth also applies to these lines.

options.title: lineWidth
options.name: plotOptions-scatter--lineWidth
options.description: The width of the line connecting the data points.

options.title: lineWidth
options.name: plotOptions-scatter-states-hover--lineWidth
options.description: The width of the line connecting the data points.

options.title: lineWidth
options.demo: 5px on all series, on one single series
options.name: plotOptions-series--lineWidth
options.description: Pixel with of the graph line.

options.title: lineWidth
options.name: plotOptions-series-marker--lineWidth
options.description: The width of the point marker's outline.

options.title: lineWidth
options.name: plotOptions-series-marker-states-hover--lineWidth
options.description: The width of the point marker's outline.

options.title: lineWidth
options.demo: 3px line width for selected points
options.name: plotOptions-series-marker-states-select--lineWidth
options.description: The width of the point marker's outline.

options.title: lineWidth
options.name: plotOptions-series-states-hover--lineWidth
options.description: Pixel with of the graph line.

options.title: lineWidth
options.name: xAxis--lineWidth
options.description: The width of the line marking the axis itself.

options.title: lineWidth
options.name: yAxis--lineWidth
options.description: The width of the line marking the axis itself.

options.title: lineWidthPlus
options.name: plotOptions-series-states-hover--lineWidthPlus
options.description: The additional line width for the graph of a hovered series.

options.title: lineWidthPlus
options.name: plotOptions-series-marker-states-hover--lineWidthPlus
options.description: The additional line width for a hovered point.

options.title: linkedTo
options.name: plotOptions-errorbar--linkedTo
options.description: The parent series of the error bar. The default value links it to the previous series. Otherwise, use the id of the parent series.

options.title: linkedTo
options.name: plotOptions-series--linkedTo
options.description: The id of another series to link to. Additionally, the value can be ":previous" to link to the previous series. When two series are linked, only the first one appears in the legend. Toggling the visibility of this also toggles the linked series.

options.title: linkedTo
options.demo: Different string formats of the same date, Y values on both sides
options.name: xAxis--linkedTo
options.description: Index of another axis that this axis is linked to. When an axis is linked to a master axis, it will take the same extremes as the master, but as assigned by min or max or by setExtremes. It can be used to show additional info, or to ease reading the chart by duplicating the scales.

options.title: load
options.name: chart-events--load
options.description:
Fires when the chart is finished loading. The this keyword refers to the chart object itself. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. This contains common event information based on jQuery or MooTools depending on which library is used as the base for Highcharts.

From version 2.0.4, there is also a second parameter to Highcharts.Chart where a callback function can be passed to be executed on chart.load.

options.title: loading
options.name: lang--loading
options.description: The loading text that appears when the chart is set into the loading state following a call to chart.showLoading.

options.title: loading
options.name: loading
options.description: The loading options control the appearance of the loading screen that covers the plot area on chart operations. This screen only appears after an explicit call to chart.showLoading(). It is a utility for developers to communicate to the end user that something is going on, for example while retrieving new data via an XHR connection. The "Loading..." text itself is not part of this configuration object, but part of the lang object.

options.title: margin
options.name: chart--margin
options.description:
The margin between the outer edge of the chart and the plot area. The numbers in the array designate top, right, bottom and left respectively. Use the options marginTop, marginRight, marginBottom and marginLeft for shorthand setting of one option.

Since version 2.1, the margin is 0 by default. The actual space is dynamically calculated from the offset of axis labels, axis title, title, subtitle and legend in addition to the spacingTop, spacingRight, spacingBottom and spacingLeft options.

Defaults to [null].

options.title: margin
options.demo: 15 pixels by default, 30 pixels.
options.name: legend--margin
options.description: If the plot area sized is calculated automatically and the legend is not floating, the legend margin is the  space between the legend and the axis labels or plot area.

options.title: margin
options.demo: A chart title margin of 50, the same margin applied with a subtitle.
options.name: title--margin
options.description: The margin between the title and the plot area, or if a subtitle is present, the margin between the subtitle and the plot area.

options.title: margin
options.name: xAxis-title--margin
options.description: The pixel distance between the axis labels or line and the title. Defaults to 0 for horizontal axes, 10 for vertical

options.title: margin
options.name: yAxis-title--margin
options.description: The pixel distance between the axis labels and the title. Positive values are outside the axis line, negative are inside.

options.title: marginBottom
options.name: chart--marginBottom
options.description: The margin between the bottom outer edge of the chart and the plot area. Use this to set a fixed pixel value for the margin as opposed to the default dynamic margin. See also spacingBottom.

options.title: marginLeft
options.name: chart--marginLeft
options.description: The margin between the left outer edge of the chart and the plot area. Use this to set a fixed pixel value for the margin as opposed to the default dynamic margin. See also spacingLeft.

options.title: marginRight
options.name: chart--marginRight
options.description: The margin between the right outer edge of the chart and the plot area. Use this to set a fixed pixel value for the margin as opposed to the default dynamic margin. See also spacingRight.

options.title: marginTop
options.name: chart--marginTop
options.description: The margin between the top outer edge of the chart and the plot area. Use this to set a fixed pixel value for the margin as opposed to the default dynamic margin. See also spacingTop.

options.title: max
options.demo: Y axis max of 200, Y axis max on logarithmic axis
options.name: xAxis--max
options.description: The maximum value of the axis. If null, the max value is automatically calculated. If the endOnTick option is true, the max value might be rounded up. The actual maximum value is also influenced by chart.alignTicks.

options.title: maxColor
options.name: yAxis--maxColor
options.description: Solid gauge only. Unless stops are set, the color to represent the maximum value of the Y axis.

options.title: maxHeight
options.name: legend--maxHeight
options.description: Maximum pixel height for the legend. When the maximum height is extended, navigation will show.

options.title: maxPadding
options.demo: Max padding of 0.25 on y axis
options.name: xAxis--maxPadding
options.description: Padding of the max value relative to the length of the axis. A padding of 0.05 will make a 100px axis 5px longer. This is useful when you don't want the highest data value to appear on the edge of the plot area. When the axis' max option is set or a max extreme is set using axis.setExtremes(), the maxPadding will be ignored.

options.title: maxPadding
options.name: yAxis--maxPadding
options.description: Padding of the max value relative to the length of the axis. A padding of 0.05 will make a 100px axis 5px longer. This is useful when you don't want the highest data value to appear on the edge of the plot area.

options.title: maxSize
options.name: plotOptions-bubble--maxSize
options.description: Maximum bubble size. Bubbles will automatically size between the minSize and maxSize to reflect the z value of each bubble. Can be either pixels (when no unit is given), or a percentage of the smallest one of the plot width and height.

options.title: maxStaggerLines
options.name: xAxis-labels--maxStaggerLines
options.description: Horizontal axis only. When staggerLines is not set, maxStaggerLines defines how many lines the axis is allowed to add to automatically avoid overlapping X labels. Set to 1 to disable overlap detection.

options.title: maxZoom
options.name: xAxis--maxZoom
options.description: Deprecated. Renamed to minRange as of Highcharts 2.2.

options.title: medianColor
options.demo: Box plot styling, error bar styling
options.name: plotOptions-boxplot--medianColor
options.description: The color of the median line. If null, the general series color applies.

options.title: medianWidth
options.name: plotOptions-boxplot--medianWidth
options.description: The pixel width of the median line. If null, the lineWidth is used.

options.title: menuItemHoverStyle
options.name: navigation--menuItemHoverStyle

options.title: menuItemStyle
options.demo: Add a grey stripe to the left
options.name: navigation--menuItemStyle

options.title: menuItems
options.demo: Skip the menu and export the chart directly, override the menu items
options.name: exporting-buttons-contextButton--menuItems
options.description:
A collection of config options for the menu items. Each options object consists of a text option which is a string to show in the menu item, as well as an onclick parameter which is a callback function to run on click.

By default, there is the "Print" menu item plus one menu item for each of the available export types. Menu items can be customized by defining a new array of items and assigning null to unwanted positions (see override example below).

options.title: menuStyle
options.name: navigation--menuStyle

options.title: min
options.demo: Y axis min of -50 with startOnTick to false, -50 with startOnTick true by default
options.name: xAxis--min
options.description: The minimum value of the axis. If null the min value is automatically calculated. If the startOnTick option is true, the min value might be rounded down.

options.title: minColor
options.name: yAxis--minColor
options.description: Solid gauge only. Unless stops are set, the color to represent the minimum value of the Y axis.

options.title: minPadding
options.name: xAxis--minPadding
options.description: Padding of the min value relative to the length of the axis. A padding of 0.05 will make a 100px axis 5px longer. This is useful when you don't want the lowest data value to appear on the edge of the plot area. When the axis' min option is set or a min extreme is set using axis.setExtremes(), the minPadding will be ignored.

options.title: minPadding
options.name: yAxis--minPadding
options.description: Padding of the min value relative to the length of the axis. A padding of 0.05 will make a 100px axis 5px longer. This is useful when you don't want the lowest data value to appear on the edge of the plot area.

options.title: minPointLength
options.demo: Set to three with zero base value, positive and negative close to zero values
options.name: plotOptions-column--minPointLength
options.description: The minimal height for a column or width for a bar. By default, 0 values are not shown. To visualize a 0 (or close to zero) point, set the minimal point length to a  pixel value like 3. In stacked column charts, minPointLength might not be respected for tightly packed values.

options.title: minRange
options.name: xAxis--minRange
options.description:
The minimum range to display on this axis. The entire axis will not be allowed to span over a smaller interval than this. For example, for a datetime axis the main unit is milliseconds. If minRange is set to 3600000, you can't zoom in more than to one hour.

The default minRange for the x axis is five times the smallest interval between any of the data points.

On a logarithmic axis, the unit for the minimum range is the power. So a minRange of 1 means that the axis can be zoomed to 10-100, 100-1000, 1000-10000 etc.

options.title: minSize
options.name: plotOptions-bubble--minSize
options.description: Minimum bubble size. Bubbles will automatically size between the minSize and maxSize to reflect the z value of each bubble. Can be either pixels (when no unit is given), or a percentage of the smallest one of the plot width and height.

options.title: minSize
options.name: plotOptions-pie--minSize
options.description: The minimum size for a pie in response to auto margins. The pie will try to shrink to make room for data labels in side the plot area, but only to this size.

options.title: minTickInterval
options.name: xAxis--minTickInterval
options.description: The minimum tick interval allowed in axis values. For example on zooming in on an axis with daily data, this can be used to prevent the axis from showing hours.

options.title: minorGridLineColor
options.demo: Bright grey lines from Y axis
options.name: xAxis--minorGridLineColor
options.description: Color of the minor, secondary grid lines.

options.title: minorGridLineDashStyle
options.demo: Long dashes on minor grid lines
options.name: xAxis--minorGridLineDashStyle
options.description: The dash or dot style of the minor grid lines. For possible values, see this demonstration.

options.title: minorGridLineWidth
options.name: xAxis--minorGridLineWidth
options.description: Width of the minor, secondary grid lines.

options.title: minorTickColor
options.demo: Black tick marks on Y axis
options.name: xAxis--minorTickColor
options.description: Color for the minor tick marks.

options.title: minorTickInterval
options.demo: Null by default, "auto" on linear Y axis, 5 units on linear Y axis, "auto" on logarithmic Y axis, 0.1 on logarithmic Y axis.
options.name: xAxis--minorTickInterval
options.description:
Tick interval in scale units for the minor ticks. On a linear axis, if "auto", the minor tick interval is calculated as a fifth of the tickInterval. If null, minor ticks are not shown.

On logarithmic axes, the unit is the power of the value. For example, setting the minorTickInterval to 1 puts one tick on each of 0.1, 1, 10, 100 etc. Setting the minorTickInterval to 0.1 produces 9 ticks between 1 and 10, 10 and 100 etc. A minorTickInterval of "auto" on a log axis results in a best guess, attempting to enter approximately 5 minor ticks between each major tick.

On axes using categories, minor ticks are not supported.

options.title: minorTickLength
options.name: xAxis--minorTickLength
options.description: The pixel length of the minor tick marks.

options.title: minorTickPosition
options.name: xAxis--minorTickPosition
options.description: The position of the minor tick marks relative to the axis line. Can be one of inside and outside.

options.title: minorTickWidth
options.name: xAxis--minorTickWidth
options.description: The pixel width of the minor tick mark.

options.title: months
options.name: lang--months
options.description: An array containing the months names. Corresponds to the %B format in Highcharts.dateFormat().

options.title: mouseOut
options.demo: Log mouse over and out with sticky tracking by default, without sticky tracking
options.name: plotOptions-series-events--mouseOut
options.description: Fires when the mouse leaves the graph. The this keyword refers to the series object itself. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. This contains common event information based on jQuery or MooTools depending on which library is used as the base for Highcharts. If the stickyTracking option is true, mouseOut doesn't happen before the mouse enters another graph or leaves the plot area.

options.title: mouseOut
options.demo: Show values in the chart's corner on mouse over
options.name: plotOptions-series-point-events--mouseOut
options.description: Fires when the mouse leaves the area close to the point. The this keyword refers to the point object itself. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. This contains common event information based on jQuery or MooTools depending on which library is used as the base for Highcharts.

options.title: mouseOver
options.demo: Log mouse over and out with sticky tracking by default, without sticky tracking
options.name: plotOptions-series-events--mouseOver
options.description: Fires when the mouse enters the graph. The this keyword refers to the series object itself. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. This contains common event information based on jQuery or MooTools depending on which library is used as the base for Highcharts.

options.title: mouseOver
options.demo: Show values in the chart's corner on mouse over
options.name: plotOptions-series-point-events--mouseOver
options.description: Fires when the mouse enters the area close to the point. The this keyword refers to the point object itself. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. This contains common event information based on jQuery or MooTools depending on which library is used as the base for Highcharts.

options.title: name
options.name: series--name
options.description: The name of the series as shown in the legend, tooltip etc.

options.title: name
options.name: series-data--name
options.description: The name of the point as shown in the legend, tooltip, dataLabel etc.

options.title: navigation
options.name: legend-navigation
options.description: Options for the paging or navigation appearing when the legend is overflown. When legend.useHTML is enabled, navigation is disabled.

options.title: navigation
options.name: navigation
options.description: A collection of options for buttons and menus appearing in the exporting module.

options.title: neckHeight
options.name: plotOptions-funnel--neckHeight
options.description: The height of the neck, the lower part of the funnel. A number defines pixel width, a percentage string defines a percentage of the plot area height.

options.title: neckWidth
options.name: plotOptions-funnel--neckWidth
options.description: The width of the neck, the lower part of the funnel. A number defines pixel width, a percentage string defines a percentage of the plot area width.

options.title: negativeColor
options.name: plotOptions-bubble--negativeColor
options.description: When a point's Z value is below the zThreshold setting, this color is used.

options.title: negativeColor
options.name: plotOptions-series--negativeColor
options.description: The color for the parts of the graph or points that are below the threshold.

options.title: negativeFillColor
options.name: plotOptions-area--negativeFillColor
options.description: A separate color for the negative part of the area.

options.title: noData
options.name: lang--noData
options.description: The text to display when the chart contains no data. Requires the no-data module, see noData.

options.title: noData
options.name: noData
options.description: Options for displaying a message like "No data to display". This feature requires the file no-data-to-display.js to be loaded in the page. The actual text to display is set in the lang.noData option.

options.title: numericSymbols
options.name: lang--numericSymbols
options.description: Metric prefixes used to shorten high numbers in axis labels. Replacing any of the positions with null causes the full number to be written. Setting numericSymbols to null disables shortening altogether.

options.title: offset
options.demo: Y axis offset of 70, Axes positioned in the center of the plot
options.name: xAxis--offset
options.description: The distance in pixels from the plot area to the axis line. A positive offset moves the axis with it's line, labels and ticks away from the plot area. This is typically used when two or more axes are displayed on the same side of the plot.

options.title: offset
options.demo: Place the axis title on top of the axis
options.name: xAxis-title--offset
options.description: The distance of the axis title from the axis line. By default, this distance is  computed from the offset width of the labels, the labels' distance from  the axis and the title's margin. However when the offset option is set, it overrides all this.

options.title: onclick
options.demo: Skip the menu and export the chart directly
options.name: exporting-buttons-contextButton--onclick
options.description: A click handler callback to use on the button directly instead of the popup menu.

options.title: opacity
options.name: plotOptions-series-states-hover-halo--opacity
options.description: Opacity for the halo unless a specific fill is overridden using the attributes setting. Note that Highcharts is only able to apply opacity to colors of hex or rgb(a) formats.

options.title: opposite
options.name: xAxis--opposite
options.description: Whether to display the axis on the opposite side of the normal. The normal is on the left side for vertical axes and bottom for horizontal, so the opposite sides will be right and top respectively. This is typically used with dual or multiple axes.

options.title: options3d
options.name: chart-options3d
options.description: Options to render charts in 3 dimensions. This feature requires highcharts-3d.js, found in the download package or online at code.highcharts.com/highcharts-3d.js.

options.title: outerRadius
options.name: yAxis-plotBands--outerRadius
options.description: In a gauge chart, this option determines the outer radius of the plot band that stretches along the perimeter. It can be given as a percentage string, like "100%", or as a pixel number, like 100.

options.title: overflow
options.name: plotOptions-series-dataLabels--overflow
options.description: How to handle data labels that flow outside the plot area. The default is justify, which aligns them inside the plot area. For columns and bars, this means it will be moved inside the bar. To display data labels outside the plot area, set crop to false and overflow to "none".

options.title: overflow
options.name: xAxis-labels--overflow
options.description: How to handle overflowing labels on horizontal axis. Can be undefined, false or "justify". By default it aligns inside the chart area. If "justify", labels will not render outside the plot area. If false, it will not be aligned at all. If there is room to move it, it will be aligned to the edge, else it will be removed.

options.title: overshoot
options.name: plotOptions-gauge--overshoot
options.description: Allow the dial to overshoot the end of the perimeter axis by this many degrees. Say if the gauge axis goes from 0 to 60, a value of 100, or 1000, will show 5 degrees beyond the end of the axis.

options.title: padding
options.demo: Padding and item margins demonstrated
options.name: legend--padding
options.description: The inner padding of the legend box.

options.title: padding
options.name: plotOptions-series-dataLabels--padding
options.description: When either the borderWidth or the backgroundColor is set, this is the padding within the box.

options.title: panKey
options.name: chart--panKey
options.description: Allows setting a key to switch between zooming and panning.

options.title: pane
options.name: pane
options.description: Applies only to polar charts and angular gauges. This configuration object holds general options for the combined X and Y axes set. Each xAxis or yAxis can reference the pane by index.

options.title: panning
options.name: chart--panning
options.description: Allow panning in a chart. Best used with panKey to combine zooming and panning.

options.title: pie
options.name: plotOptions-pie
options.description: A pie chart is a circular chart divided into sectors, illustrating numerical proportion.

options.title: pinchType
options.name: chart--pinchType
options.description: Equivalent to zoomType, but for multitouch gestures only. By default, the pinchType is the same as the zoomType setting. However, pinching can be enabled separately in some cases, for example in stock charts where a mouse drag pans the chart, while pinching is enabled.

options.title: pivot
options.name: plotOptions-gauge-pivot
options.description: Options for the pivot or the center point of the gauge.

options.title: plotBackgroundColor
options.name: chart--plotBackgroundColor
options.description: The background color or gradient for the plot area.

options.title: plotBackgroundImage
options.name: chart--plotBackgroundImage
options.description: The URL for an image to use as the plot background. To set an image as the background for the entire chart, set a CSS background image to the container element. Note that for the image to be applied to exported charts, its URL needs to be accessible by the export server.

options.title: plotBands
options.name: yAxis-plotBands
options.description: An array of objects defining plot bands on the Y axis.

options.title: plotBands
options.name: xAxis-plotBands
options.description:
An array of colored bands stretching across the plot area marking an interval on the axis.

In a gauge, a plot band on the Y axis (value axis) will stretch along the perimeter of the gauge.

options.title: plotBorderColor
options.name: chart--plotBorderColor
options.description: The color of the inner chart or plot area border.

options.title: plotBorderWidth
options.name: chart--plotBorderWidth
options.description: The pixel width of the plot area border.

options.title: plotLines
options.name: xAxis-plotLines
options.description: An array of lines stretching across the plot area, marking a specific value on one of the axes.

options.title: plotLines
options.name: yAxis-plotLines
options.description: An array of objects representing plot lines on the X axis

options.title: plotOptions
options.name: plotOptions
options.description:
The plotOptions is a wrapper object for config objects for each series type. The config objects for each series can also be overridden for each series item as given in the series array.

Configuration options for the series are given in three levels. Options for all series in a chart are given in the plotOptions.series object. Then options for all series of a specific type are given in the plotOptions of that type, for example plotOptions.line. Next, options for one single series are given in the series array.

options.title: plotShadow
options.name: chart--plotShadow
options.description: Whether to apply a drop shadow to the plot area. Requires that plotBackgroundColor be set. Since 2.3 the shadow can be an object configuration containing color, offsetX, offsetY, opacity and width.

options.title: point
options.name: plotOptions-series-point
options.description: Properties for each single point

options.title: pointFormat
options.demo: A different point format with value suffix
options.name: tooltip--pointFormat
options.description: The HTML of the point's line in the tooltip. Variables are enclosed by curly brackets. Available variables are point.x, point.y, series.name and series.color and other properties on the same form. Furthermore, point.y can be extended by the tooltip.yPrefix and tooltip.ySuffix variables. This can also be overridden for each series, which makes it a good hook for displaying units.

options.title: pointInterval
options.name: plotOptions-series--pointInterval
options.description: If no x values are given for the points in a series, pointInterval defines the interval of the x values. For example, if a series contains one value every decade starting from year 0, set pointInterval to 10.

options.title: pointPadding
options.demo: 0.1 by default, 0.25, 0 for tightly packed columns,
options.name: plotOptions-column--pointPadding
options.description: Padding between each column or bar, in x axis units.

options.title: pointPlacement
options.demo: Between in a column chart, numeric placement for custom layout.
options.name: plotOptions-series--pointPlacement
options.description:
Possible values: null, "on", "between".

In a column chart, when pointPlacement is "on", the point will not create any padding of the X axis. In a polar column chart this means that the first column points directly north. If the pointPlacement is "between", the columns will be laid out between ticks. This is useful for example for visualising an amount between two points in time or in a certain sector of a polar chart.

Since Highcharts 3.0.2, the point placement can also be numeric, where 0 is on the axis value, -0.5 is between this value and the previous, and 0.5 is between this value and the next. Unlike the textual options, numeric point placement options won't affect axis padding.

Defaults to null in cartesian charts, "between" in polar charts.

options.title: pointRange
options.demo: Set the point range to one day on a data set with one week between the points
options.name: plotOptions-column--pointRange
options.description: The X axis range that each point is valid for. This determines the width of the column. On a categorized axis, the range will be 1 by default (one category unit). On linear and datetime axes, the range will be computed as the distance between the two closest data points.

options.title: pointStart
options.name: plotOptions-series--pointStart
options.description: If no x values are given for the points in a series, pointStart defines on what value to start. For example, if a series contains one yearly value starting from 1945, set pointStart to 1945.

options.title: pointWidth
options.demo: 20px wide columns regardless of chart width or the amount of data points
options.name: plotOptions-column--pointWidth
options.description: A pixel value specifying a fixed width for each column or bar. When null, the width is calculated from the pointPadding and groupPadding.

options.title: polar
options.demo: Polar line, polar area, polar column, combined series types, spider chart, wind rose.
options.name: chart--polar
options.description: When true, cartesian charts like line, spline, area and column are transformed into the polar coordinate system. Requires highcharts-more.js.

options.title: position
options.name: chart-resetZoomButton--position
options.description: The position of the button. This is an object that can hold the properties align, verticalAlign, x and y.

options.title: position
options.name: credits--position
options.description:
Position configuration for the credits label. Supported properties are align, verticalAlign, x and y. Defaults to 
position: {
	align: 'right',
	x: -10,
	verticalAlign: 'bottom',
	y: -5
}

options.title: position
options.name: drilldown-drillUpButton--position
options.description: Positioning options for the button within the relativeTo box. Available properties are x, y, align and verticalAlign.

options.title: position
options.name: noData--position
options.description: The position of the no-data label, relative to the plot area.

options.title: positioner
options.name: tooltip--positioner
options.description:
A callback function to place the tooltip in a default position. The callback receives three parameters: labelWidth, labelHeight and point, where point contains values for plotX and plotY telling where the reference point is in the plot area. Add chart.plotLeft and chart.plotTop to get the full coordinates.

The return should be an object containing x and y values, for example { x: 100, y: 100 }.

options.title: printChart
options.name: lang--printChart
options.description: Exporting module only. The text for the menu item to print the chart.

options.title: pyramid
options.name: plotOptions-pyramid
options.description: A pyramid chart consists of a single pyramid with item heights corresponding to each point value. Technically it is the same as a reversed funnel chart without a neck.

options.title: radius
options.name: plotOptions-gauge-dial--radius
options.description: The radius or length of the dial, in percentages relative to the radius of the gauge itself.

options.title: radius
options.name: plotOptions-gauge-pivot--radius
options.description: The pixel radius of the pivot.

options.title: radius
options.name: plotOptions-series-marker--radius
options.description: The radius of the point marker.

options.title: radius
options.name: plotOptions-series-marker-states-select--radius
options.description:
The radius of the point marker. In hover state, it defaults
		to the normal state's radius + 2.

options.title: radius
options.name: plotOptions-series-marker-states-hover--radius
options.description: The radius of the point marker. In hover state, it defaults to the normal state's radius + 2 as per the radiusPlus option.

options.title: radiusPlus
options.demo: 5 pixels greater radius on hover
options.name: plotOptions-series-marker-states-hover--radiusPlus
options.description: The number of pixels to increase the radius of the hovered point.

options.title: rearLength
options.name: plotOptions-gauge-dial--rearLength
options.description: The length of the dial's rear end, the part that extends out on the other side of the pivot. Relative to the dial's length.

options.title: redraw
options.name: chart-events--redraw
options.description: Fires when the chart is redrawn, either after a call to chart.redraw() or after an axis, series or point is modified with the redraw option set to true. The this keyword refers to the chart object itself. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. This contains common event information based on jQuery or MooTools depending on which library is used as the base for Highcharts.

options.title: reflow
options.demo: Move the bar between the JavaScript frame and the Preview frame to see the effect: True by default, false.
options.name: chart--reflow
options.description: Whether to reflow the chart to fit the width of the container div on resizing the window.

options.title: relativeTo
options.name: chart-resetZoomButton--relativeTo
options.description: What frame the button should be placed related to. Can be either "plot" or "chart".

options.title: relativeTo
options.name: drilldown-drillUpButton--relativeTo
options.description: What box to align the button to. Can be either "plotBox" or "spacingBox".

options.title: remove
options.name: plotOptions-series-point-events--remove
options.description: Fires when the point is removed using the .remove() method. The this keyword refers to the point object itself. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. Returning false cancels the operation.

options.title: renderTo
options.demo: String, object reference, object reference through jQuery,
options.name: chart--renderTo
options.description: The HTML element where the chart will be rendered. If it is a string, the element by that id is used. The HTML element can also be passed by direct reference.

options.title: resetZoom
options.name: lang--resetZoom
options.description: The text for the label appearing when a chart is zoomed.

options.title: resetZoomButton
options.name: chart-resetZoomButton
options.description: The button that appears after a selection zoom, allowing the user to reset zoom.

options.title: resetZoomTitle
options.name: lang--resetZoomTitle
options.description: The tooltip title for the label appearing when a chart is zoomed.

options.title: reversed
options.name: plotOptions-funnel--reversed
options.description: A reversed funnel has the widest area down. A reversed funnel with no neck width and neck height is a pyramid.

options.title: reversed
options.name: xAxis--reversed
options.description: Whether to reverse the axis so that the highest number is closest to the origin. If the chart is inverted, the x axis is reversed by default.

options.title: reversed
options.name: plotOptions-pyramid--reversed
options.description: The pyramid is reversed by default, as opposed to the funnel, which shares the layout engine, and is not reversed.

options.title: reversed
options.name: legend--reversed
options.description: Whether to reverse the order of the legend items compared to the order of the series or points as defined in the configuration object.

options.title: reversedStacks
options.name: yAxis--reversedStacks
options.description: If true, the first series in a stack will be drawn on top in a positive, non-reversed Y axis. If false, the first series is in the base of the stack.

options.title: rotation
options.name: plotOptions-series-dataLabels--rotation
options.description: Text rotation in degrees. Note that due to a more complex structure, backgrounds and borders will be lost on a rotated data label.

options.title: rotation
options.name: xAxis-labels--rotation
options.description: Rotation of the labels in degrees.

options.title: rotation
options.name: xAxis-plotBands-label--rotation
options.description: Rotation of the text label in degrees .

options.title: rotation
options.name: xAxis-plotLines-label--rotation
options.description: Rotation of the text label in degrees. Defaults to 0 for horizontal plot lines and 90 for vertical lines.

options.title: rotation
options.name: xAxis-title--rotation
options.description: The rotation of the text in degrees. 0 is horizontal, 270 is vertical reading from bottom to top.

options.title: rotation
options.name: yAxis-stackLabels--rotation
options.description: Rotation of the labels in degrees.

options.title: rotation
options.name: yAxis-title--rotation
options.description: The rotation of the text in degrees. 0 is horizontal, 270 is  vertical reading from bottom to top.

options.title: rtl
options.name: legend--rtl
options.description: Whether to show the symbol on the right side of the text rather than the left side.  This is common in Arabic and Hebraic.

options.title: scale
options.name: exporting--scale
options.description: Defines the scale or zoom factor for the exported image compared to the on-screen display. While for instance a 600px wide chart may look good on a website, it will look bad in print. The default scale of 2 makes this chart export to a 1200px PNG or JPG.

options.title: select
options.name: plotOptions-series-marker-states-select
options.description: The appearance of the point marker when selected. In order to allow a point to be selected, set the series.allowPointSelect option to true.

options.title: select
options.name: plotOptions-series-point-events--select
options.description: Fires when the point is selected either programmatically or following a click on the point. The this keyword refers to the point object itself. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. Returning false cancels the operation.

options.title: selected
options.demo: One out of two series selected
options.name: plotOptions-series--selected
options.description: Whether to select the series initially. If showCheckbox is true, the checkbox next to the series name will be checked for a selected series.

options.title: selection
options.name: chart-events--selection
options.description:
Fires when an area of the chart has been selected. Selection is enabled by setting the chart's zoomType. The this keyword refers to the chart object itself. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. This contains common event information based on jQuery or MooTools depending on which library is used as the base for Highcharts. The default action for the selection event is to zoom the chart to the selected area. It can be prevented by calling event.preventDefault().

Information on the selected area can be found through event.xAxis and event.yAxis, which are arrays containing the axes of each dimension and each axis' min and max values. The primary axes are event.xAxis[0] and event.yAxis[0]. Remember the unit of a datetime axis is milliseconds since 1970-01-01 00:00:00.

selection: function(event) {
	// log the min and max of the primary, datetime x-axis
	console.log(
		Highcharts.dateFormat('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S', event.xAxis[0].min),
		Highcharts.dateFormat('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S', event.xAxis[0].max)
	);
	// log the min and max of the y axis
	console.log(event.yAxis[0].min, event.yAxis[0].max);
}

options.title: selectionMarkerFill
options.name: chart--selectionMarkerFill
options.description: The background color of the marker square when selecting (zooming in on) an area of the chart.

options.title: series
options.name: plotOptions-series
options.description: General options for all series types.

options.title: series
options.name: series
options.description: The actual series to append to the chart. In addition to the members listed below, any member of the plotOptions for that specific type of plot can be added to a series individually. For example, even though a general lineWidth is specified in plotOptions.series, an individual lineWidth can be specified for each series.

options.title: series
options.name: drilldown--series
options.description: An array of series configurations for the drill down. Each series configuration uses the same syntax as the series option set. These drilldown series are hidden by default. The drilldown series is linked to the parent series' point by its id.

options.title: setExtremes
options.name: xAxis-events--setExtremes
options.description:
Fires when the minimum and maximum is set for the axis, either by calling the .setExtremes() method or by selecting an area in the chart. The this keyword refers to the axis object itself. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. This contains common event information based on jQuery or MooTools depending on which library is used as the base for Highcharts.

The new user set minimum and maximum values can be found by event.min and event.max. When an axis is zoomed all the way out from the "Reset zoom" button, event.min and event.max are null, and the new extremes are set based on this.dataMin and this.dataMax.

options.title: shadow
options.name: chart--shadow
options.description: Whether to apply a drop shadow to the outer chart area. Requires that backgroundColor be set. Since 2.3 the shadow can be an object configuration containing color, offsetX, offsetY, opacity and width.

options.title: shadow
options.name: legend--shadow
options.description: Whether to apply a drop shadow to the legend. A backgroundColor also needs to be applied for this to take effect. Since 2.3 the shadow can be an object configuration containing color, offsetX, offsetY, opacity and width.

options.title: shadow
options.name: plotOptions-arearange--shadow
options.description: Whether to apply a drop shadow to the graph line. Since 2.3 the shadow can be an object configuration containing color, offsetX, offsetY, opacity and width.

options.title: shadow
options.name: plotOptions-series--shadow
options.description: Whether to apply a drop shadow to the graph line. Since 2.3 the shadow can be an object configuration containing color, offsetX, offsetY, opacity and width.

options.title: shadow
options.name: plotOptions-series-dataLabels--shadow
options.description: The shadow of the box. Works best with borderWidth or backgroundColor. Since 2.3 the shadow can be an object configuration containing color, offsetX, offsetY, opacity and width.

options.title: shadow
options.name: tooltip--shadow
options.description: Whether to apply a drop shadow to the tooltip.

options.title: shape
options.name: tooltip--shape
options.description: The name of a symbol to use for the border around the tooltip. In Highcharts 3.x and less, the shape was square.

options.title: shared
options.demo: False by default, true, true with x axis crosshair, true with mixed series types.
options.name: tooltip--shared
options.description: When the tooltip is shared, the entire plot area will capture mouse movement or touch events. Tooltip texts for series types with ordered data (not pie, scatter, flags etc) will be shown in a single bubble. This is recommended for single series charts and for tablet/mobile optimized charts.

options.title: shortMonths
options.name: lang--shortMonths
options.description: An array containing the months names in abbreviated form. Corresponds to the %b format in Highcharts.dateFormat().

options.title: show
options.demo: Alert when the series is shown by clicking the legend item.
options.name: plotOptions-series-events--show
options.description: Fires when the series is shown after chart generation time, either by clicking the legend item or by calling .show().

options.title: showAxes
options.name: chart--showAxes
options.description: Whether to show the axes initially. This only applies to empty charts where series are added dynamically, as axes are automatically added to cartesian series.

options.title: showCheckbox
options.name: plotOptions-series--showCheckbox
options.description: If true, a checkbox is displayed next to the legend item to allow selecting the series. The state of the checkbox is determined by the selected option.

options.title: showDuration
options.demo: Fade in and out over a second
options.name: loading--showDuration
options.description: The duration in milliseconds of the fade in effect.

options.title: showEmpty
options.demo: When clicking the legend to hide series, one axis preserves line and title, the other doesn't
options.name: xAxis--showEmpty
options.description: Whether to show the axis line and title when the axis has no data.

options.title: showFirstLabel
options.demo: Set to false on X axis
options.name: xAxis--showFirstLabel
options.description: Whether to show the first tick label.

options.title: showInLegend
options.name: plotOptions-gauge--showInLegend
options.description: Whether to display this particular series or series type in the legend. Defaults to false for gauge series.

options.title: showInLegend
options.demo: One series in the legend, one hidden
options.name: plotOptions-pie--showInLegend
options.description: Whether to display this particular series or series type in the legend. Since 2.1, pies are not shown in the legend by default.

options.title: showInLegend
options.demo: One series in the legend, one hidden
options.name: plotOptions-series--showInLegend
options.description: Whether to display this particular series or series type in the legend. The default value is true for standalone series, false for linked series.

options.title: showLastLabel
options.demo: Set to true on X axis
options.name: xAxis--showLastLabel
options.description: Whether to show the last tick label.

options.title: showLastLabel
options.demo: Set to true on X axis
options.name: yAxis--showLastLabel
options.description: Whether to show the last tick label.

options.title: side
options.name: chart-options3d-frame-side
options.description: The side for the frame around a 3D chart.

options.title: size
options.name: plotOptions-pie--size
options.description: The diameter of the pie relative to the plot area. Can be a percentage or pixel value. Pixel values are given as integers. The default behaviour (as of 3.0) is to scale to the plot area and give room for data labels within the plot area. As a consequence, the size of the pie may vary when points are updated and data labels more around. In that case it is best to set a fixed value, for example "75%".

options.title: size
options.name: plotOptions-series-states-hover-halo--size
options.description: The pixel size of the halo. For point markers this is the radius of the halo. For pie slices it is the width of the halo outside the slice. For bubbles it defaults to 5 and is the width of the halo outside the bubble.

options.title: size
options.name: chart-options3d-frame-bottom--size
options.description: The thickness of the panel.

options.title: size
options.name: chart-options3d-frame-side--size
options.description: The thickness of the panel.

options.title: size
options.name: chart-options3d-frame-back--size
options.description: Thickness of the panel.

options.title: size
options.name: pane--size
options.description: The size of the pane, either as a number defining pixels, or a percentage defining a percentage of the plot are.

options.title: sizeBy
options.name: plotOptions-bubble--sizeBy
options.description: Whether the bubble's value should be represented by the area or the width of the bubble. The default, area, corresponds best to the human perception of the size of each bubble.

options.title: sliced
options.name: series-data--sliced
options.description: Pie series only. Whether to display a slice offset from the center.

options.title: slicedOffset
options.name: plotOptions-pie--slicedOffset
options.description: If a point is sliced, moved out from the center, how many pixels should  it be moved?.

options.title: snap
options.demo: 10 px by default, 50 px on graph
options.name: tooltip--snap
options.description: Proximity snap for graphs or single points. Does not apply to bars, columns and pie slices. It defaults to 10 for mouse-powered devices and 25 for touch  devices.

options.title: softConnector
options.name: plotOptions-pie-dataLabels--softConnector
options.description: Whether to render the connector as a soft arc or a line with sharp break.

options.title: solidgauge
options.name: plotOptions-solidgauge
options.description: A gauge showing values using a filled arc with colors indicating the value. The solid gauge plots values against the yAxis, which is extended with some color options, minColor, maxColor and stops, to control the color of the gauge itself.

options.title: sourceHeight
options.name: exporting--sourceHeight
options.description: Analogous to sourceWidth

options.title: sourceWidth
options.name: exporting--sourceWidth
options.description: The width of the original chart when exported, unless an explicit chart.width is set. The width exported raster image is then multiplied by scale.

options.title: spacing
options.name: chart--spacing
options.description: The distance between the outer edge of the chart and the content, like title, legend, axis title or labels. The numbers in the array designate top, right, bottom and left respectively. Use the options spacingTop, spacingRight, spacingBottom and spacingLeft options for shorthand setting of one option.

options.title: spacingBottom
options.name: chart--spacingBottom
options.description: The space between the bottom edge of the chart and the content (plot area, axis title and labels, title, subtitle or legend in top position).

options.title: spacingLeft
options.name: chart--spacingLeft
options.description: The space between the left edge of the chart and the content (plot area, axis title and labels, title, subtitle or legend in top position).

options.title: spacingRight
options.demo: Spacing set to 100, legend in right position with default spacing
options.name: chart--spacingRight
options.description: The space between the right edge of the chart and the content (plot area, axis title and labels, title, subtitle or legend in top position).

options.title: spacingTop
options.demo: A top spacing of 100, floating chart title makes the plot area align to the default spacingTop of 10..
options.name: chart--spacingTop
options.description: The space between the top edge of the chart and the content (plot area, axis title and labels, title, subtitle or legend in top position).

options.title: stack
options.name: series--stack
options.description: This option allows grouping series in a stacked chart. The stack option can be a string  or a number or anything else, as long as the grouped series' stack options match each other.

options.title: stackLabels
options.name: yAxis-stackLabels
options.description:
The stack labels show the total value for each bar in a stacked column or bar chart. The label will be placed on top of
	positive columns and below negative columns. In case of an inverted column chart or a bar chart the label is placed to 
	the right of positive bars and to the left of negative bars.

options.title: stacking
options.demo: Line, column, bar, area with "normal" stacking. Line, column, bar, area with "percent" stacking.
options.name: plotOptions-series--stacking
options.description: Whether to stack the values of each series on top of each other. Possible values are null to disable, "normal" to stack by value or "percent".

options.title: staggerLines
options.name: plotOptions-series-dataLabels--staggerLines
options.description: n/a for data labels

options.title: staggerLines
options.name: xAxis-labels--staggerLines
options.description: Horizontal axes only. The number of lines to spread the labels over to make room or tighter labels.  .

options.title: startAngle
options.demo: VU-meter with custom start and end angle.
options.name: pane--startAngle
options.description: The start angle of the polar X axis or gauge axis, given in degrees where 0 is north. Defaults to 0.

options.title: startAngle
options.name: plotOptions-pie--startAngle
options.description: The start angle of the pie slices in degrees where 0 is top and 90 right.

options.title: startOfWeek
options.name: xAxis--startOfWeek
options.description: For datetime axes, this decides where to put the tick between weeks. 0 = Sunday, 1 = Monday.

options.title: startOnTick
options.demo: False by default, true on X axis
options.name: xAxis--startOnTick
options.description: Whether to force the axis to start on a tick. Use this option with the maxPadding option to control the axis start.

options.title: startOnTick
options.demo: False by default, true on X axis
options.name: yAxis--startOnTick
options.description: Whether to force the axis to start on a tick. Use this option with the maxPadding option to control the axis start.

options.title: states
options.name: plotOptions-series-states
options.description: A wrapper object for all the series options in specific states.

options.title: stemColor
options.demo: Box plot styling, error bar styling
options.name: plotOptions-boxplot--stemColor
options.description: The color of the stem, the vertical line extending from the box to the whiskers. If null, the series color is used.

options.title: stemDashStyle
options.demo: Box plot styling, error bar styling
options.name: plotOptions-boxplot--stemDashStyle
options.description: The dash style of the stem, the vertical line extending from the box to the whiskers.

options.title: stemWidth
options.demo: Box plot styling, error bar styling
options.name: plotOptions-boxplot--stemWidth
options.description: The width of the stem, the vertical line extending from the box to the whiskers. If null, the width is inherited from the lineWidth option.

options.title: step
options.name: plotOptions-line--step
options.description: Whether to apply steps to the line. Possible values are left, center and right. Prior to 2.3.5, only left was supported.

options.title: step
options.name: plotOptions-series-dataLabels--step
options.description: n/a for data labels

options.title: step
options.demo: Showing only every other axis label on a categorized x axis. Auto steps on a category axis.
options.name: xAxis-labels--step
options.description:
To show only every n'th label on the axis, set the step to n. Setting the step to 2 shows every other label.

By default, the step is calculated automatically to avoid overlap. To prevent this, set it to 1. This usually only happens on a category axis, and is often a sign that you have chosen the wrong axis type. Read more at Axis docs => What axis should I use?

options.title: stickyTracking
options.name: plotOptions-pie--stickyTracking
options.description: Sticky tracking of mouse events. When true, the mouseOut event on a series isn't triggered until the mouse moves over another series, or out of the plot area. When false, the mouseOut event on a series is triggered when the mouse leaves the area around the series' graph or markers. This also implies the tooltip. When stickyTracking is false and tooltip.shared is false, the tooltip will be hidden when moving the mouse between series.

options.title: stickyTracking
options.name: plotOptions-scatter--stickyTracking
options.description: Sticky tracking of mouse events. When true, the mouseOut event on a series isn't triggered until the mouse moves over another series, or out of the plot area. When false, the mouseOut event on a series is triggered when the mouse leaves the area around the series' graph or markers. This also implies the tooltip. When stickyTracking is false and tooltip.shared is false, the tooltip will be hidden when moving the mouse between series.

options.title: stickyTracking
options.name: plotOptions-series--stickyTracking
options.description: Sticky tracking of mouse events. When true, the mouseOut event on a series isn't triggered until the mouse moves over another series, or out of the plot area. When false, the mouseOut event on a series is triggered when the mouse leaves the area around the series' graph or markers. This also implies the tooltip. When stickyTracking is false and tooltip.shared is false, the tooltip will be hidden when moving the mouse between series. Defaults to true for line and area type series, but to false for columns, pies etc.

options.title: stops
options.name: yAxis--stops
options.description:
Solid gauge series only. Color stops for the solid gauge. Use this in cases where a linear gradient between a minColor and maxColor is not sufficient. The stops is an array of tuples, where the first item is a float between 0 and 1 assigning the relative position in the gradient, and the second item is the color.

For solid gauges, the Y axis also inherits the concept of data classes from the Highmaps color axis.

options.title: style
options.name: chart--style

options.title: style
options.name: credits--style

options.title: style
options.name: labels--style

options.title: style
options.name: labels-items--style

options.title: style
options.name: legend--style
options.description: CSS styles for the legend area. In the 1.x versions the position of the legend area was determined by CSS. In 2.x, the position is determined by properties like align, verticalAlign, x and y, but the styles are still parsed for backwards compatibility.

options.title: style
options.name: legend-navigation--style
options.description: Text styles for the legend page navigation.

options.title: style
options.name: legend-title--style

options.title: style
options.name: loading--style
options.description:
CSS styles for the loading screen that covers the plot area. Defaults to: 
style: {
	position: 'absolute',
	backgroundColor: 'white',
	opacity: 0.5,
	textAlign: 'center'
}

options.title: style
options.name: plotOptions-series-dataLabels--style
options.description: Styles for the label.

options.title: style
options.name: noData--style
options.description: CSS styles for the no-data label.

options.title: style
options.name: subtitle--style
options.description: CSS styles for the title. Exact positioning of the title can be achieved by changing the margin property, or by adding position: "absolute" and left and top properties.

options.title: style
options.name: title--style
options.description: CSS styles for the title. Use this for font styling, but use align, x and y for text alignment.

options.title: style
options.name: tooltip--style

options.title: style
options.name: xAxis-plotBands-label--style
options.description: CSS styles for the text label.

options.title: style
options.name: xAxis-plotLines-label--style
options.description: CSS styles for the text label.

options.title: style
options.name: xAxis-title--style

options.title: symbol
options.name: plotOptions-series-marker--symbol
options.description:
A predefined shape or symbol for the marker. When null, the symbol is pulled from options.symbols. Other possible values are "circle", "square", "diamond", "triangle" and "triangle-down".

Additionally, the URL to a graphic can be given on this form: "url(graphic.png)". Note that for the image to be applied to exported charts, its URL needs to be accessible by the export server.

Custom callbacks for symbol path generation can also be added to Highcharts.SVGRenderer.prototype.symbols. The callback is then used by its method name, as shown in the demo.

options.title: symbolFill

options.title: symbolHeight

options.description: The pixel height of the symbol for series types that use a rectangle in the legend.

options.title: symbolPadding
options.name: legend--symbolPadding
options.description: The pixel padding between the legend item symbol and the legend item text.

options.name: legend--symbolRadius

options.title: symbolSize
options.name: navigation-buttonOptions--symbolSize

options.title: symbolStroke

options.title: text
options.name: credits--text
options.description: The text for the credits label.

options.title: text
options.name: legend-title--text
options.description: A text or HTML string for the title.

options.title: text

options.name: navigation-buttonOptions--text
options.description: A text string to add to the individual button.

options.name: subtitle--text
options.description: The subtitle of the chart.

options.name: title--text
options.description: The title of the chart. To disable the title, set the text to null.
