options.name: xAxis-plotBands-label--text
options.description: The string text itself. A subset of HTML is supported.

options.title: text
options.name: xAxis-plotLines-label--text
options.description: The text itself. A subset of HTML is supported.

options.title: text
options.demo: Custom HTML title for X axis
options.name: xAxis-title--text
options.description: The actual text of the axis title. It can contain basic HTML text markup like <b>, <i> and spans with style.

options.title: text
options.demo: Custom HTML title for X axis
options.name: yAxis-title--text
options.description: The actual text of the axis title. Horizontal texts can contain HTML, but rotated texts are painted using vector techniques and must be clean text. The Y axis title is disabled by setting the text option to null.

options.title: textAlign
options.demo: Vertical text in center position but text-aligned left
options.name: xAxis-plotBands-label--textAlign
options.description: The text alignment for the label. While align determines where the texts anchor point is placed within the plot band, textAlign determines how the text is aligned against its anchor point. Possible values are "left", "center" and "right". Defaults to the same as the align option.

options.title: textAlign
options.name: xAxis-plotLines-label--textAlign
options.description: The text alignment for the label. While align determines where the texts anchor point is placed within the plot band, textAlign determines how the text is aligned against its anchor point. Possible values are "left", "center" and "right". Defaults to the same as the align option.

options.title: textAlign
options.demo: Label in center position but text-aligned left
options.name: yAxis-stackLabels--textAlign
options.description: The text alignment for the label. While align determines where the texts anchor point is placed with regards to the stack, textAlign determines how the text is aligned against its anchor point. Possible values are "left", "center" and "right". The default value is calculated at runtime and depends on orientation and whether the stack is positive or negative.

options.title: theme
options.name: chart-resetZoomButton--theme
options.description: A collection of attributes for the button. The object takes SVG attributes like fill, stroke, stroke-width or r, the border radius. The theme also supports style, a collection of CSS properties for the text. Equivalent attributes for the hover state are given in theme.states.hover.

options.title: theme
options.name: navigation-buttonOptions--theme
options.description: A configuration object for the button theme. The object accepts SVG properties like stroke-width, stroke and fill. Tri-state button styles are supported by the states.hover and states.select objects.

options.title: theme
options.name: drilldown-drillUpButton--theme
options.description: A collection of attributes for the button. The object takes SVG attributes like fill, stroke, stroke-width or r, the border radius. The theme also supports style, a collection of CSS properties for the text. Equivalent attributes for the hover state are given in theme.states.hover.

options.title: thickness
options.name: yAxis-plotBands--thickness
options.description: In a gauge chart, this option sets the width of the plot band stretching along the perimeter. It can be given as a percentage string, like "10%", or as a pixel number, like 10. The default value 10 is the same as the default tickLength, thus making the plot band act as a background for the tick markers.

options.title: thousandsSep
options.name: lang--thousandsSep
options.description: The default thousands separator used in the Highcharts.numberFormat method unless otherwise specified in the function arguments.

options.title: threshold
options.name: plotOptions-area--threshold
options.description: The Y axis value to serve as the base for the area, for distinguishing between values above and below a threshold. If null, the area behaves like a line series with fill between the graph and the Y axis minimum.

options.title: threshold
options.name: plotOptions-column--threshold
options.description: The Y axis value to serve as the base for the columns, for distinguishing between values above and below a threshold. If null, the columns extend from the padding Y axis minimum.

options.title: threshold
options.name: plotOptions-series--threshold
options.description: The threshold, also called zero level or base level. For line type series this is only used in conjunction with negativeColor.

options.title: tickColor
options.name: xAxis--tickColor
options.description: Color for the main tick marks.

options.title: tickInterval
options.demo: Tick interval of 5 on a linear axis
options.name: xAxis--tickInterval
options.description:
The interval of the tick marks in axis units. When null, the tick interval is computed to approximately follow the tickPixelInterval on linear and datetime axes. On categorized axes, a null tickInterval will default to 1, one category. Note that datetime axes are based on milliseconds, so for example an interval of one day is expressed as 24 * 3600 * 1000.

On logarithmic axes, the tickInterval is based on powers, so a tickInterval of 1 means one tick on each of 0.1, 1, 10, 100 etc. A tickInterval of 2 means a tick of 0.1, 10, 1000 etc. A tickInterval of 0.2 puts a tick on 0.1, 0.2, 0.4, 0.6, 0.8, 1, 2, 4, 6, 8, 10, 20, 40 etc.

options.title: tickLength
options.demo: 20 px tick length on the X axis
options.name: xAxis--tickLength
options.description: The pixel length of the main tick marks.

options.title: tickPixelInterval
options.name: xAxis--tickPixelInterval
options.description: If tickInterval is null this option sets the approximate pixel interval of the tick marks. Not applicable to categorized axis. Defaults to 72 for the Y axis and 100 for the X axis.

options.title: tickPosition
options.demo: "outside" by default, "inside" on X axis
options.name: xAxis--tickPosition
options.description: The position of the major tick marks relative to the axis line. Can be one of inside and outside.

options.title: tickPositioner
options.name: xAxis--tickPositioner
options.description: A callback function returning array defining where the ticks are laid out on the axis. This overrides the default behaviour of tickPixelInterval and tickInterval.

options.title: tickPositions
options.name: xAxis--tickPositions
options.description: An array defining where the ticks are laid out on the axis. This overrides the default behaviour of tickPixelInterval and tickInterval.

options.title: tickWidth
options.name: xAxis--tickWidth
options.description: The pixel width of the major tick marks.

options.title: tickWidth
options.name: yAxis--tickWidth
options.description: The pixel width of the major tick marks.

options.title: tickmarkPlacement
options.name: xAxis--tickmarkPlacement
options.description: For categorized axes only. If "on" the tick mark is placed in the center of  the category, if "between" the tick mark is placed between categories.

options.title: timezoneOffset
options.name: global--timezoneOffset
options.description: The timezone offset in minutes. Positive values are west, negative values are east of UTC, as in the ECMAScript getTimezoneOffset method. Use this to display UTC based data in a predefined time zone.

options.title: title
options.name: legend-title
options.description: A title to be added on top of the legend.

options.title: title
options.name: title
options.description: The chart's main title.

options.title: title
options.name: xAxis-title
options.description: The axis title, showing next to the axis line.

options.title: to
options.name: xAxis-plotBands--to
options.description: The end position of the plot band in axis units.

options.title: tooltip
options.name: plotOptions-series-tooltip
options.description: A configuration object for the tooltip rendering of each single series. Properties are inherited from tooltip, but only the following properties can be defined on a series level.

options.title: tooltip
options.name: tooltip
options.description: Options for the tooltip that appears when the user hovers over a series or point.

options.title: topWidth
options.name: plotOptions-gauge-dial--topWidth
options.description: The width of the top of the dial, closest to the perimeter. The pivot narrows in from the base to the top.

options.title: trackByArea
options.demo: Display the tooltip when the area is hovered
options.name: plotOptions-area--trackByArea
options.description: Whether the whole area or just the line should respond to mouseover tooltips and other mouse or touch events.

options.title: trackByArea
options.name: plotOptions-arearange--trackByArea
options.description: Whether the whole area or just the line should respond to mouseover tooltips and other mouse or touch events.

options.title: turboThreshold
options.name: plotOptions-series--turboThreshold
options.description: When a series contains a data array that is longer than this, only one dimensional arrays of numbers, or two dimensional arrays with x and y values are allowed. Also, only the first point is tested, and the rest are assumed to be the same format. This saves expensive data checking and indexing in long series. Set it to 0 disable.

options.title: type
options.name: chart--type
options.description: The default series type for the chart. Can be any of the chart types listed under plotOptions.

options.title: type
options.name: exporting--type
options.description: Default MIME type for exporting if chart.exportChart() is called without specifying a type option. Possible values are image/png, image/jpeg, application/pdf and image/svg+xml.

options.title: type
options.demo: Line and column in the same chart
options.name: series--type
options.description: The type of series. Can be one of area, areaspline, bar, column, line, pie, scatter or spline. From version 2.3, arearange, areasplinerange and columnrange are supported with the highcharts-more.js component.

options.title: type
options.demo: "linear", "datetime" with regular intervals, "datetime" with irregular intervals, "logarithmic", "logarithmic" with minor grid lines, "logarithmic" on two axes.
options.name: xAxis--type
options.description: The type of axis. Can be one of "linear", "logarithmic", "datetime" or "category". In a datetime axis, the numbers are given in milliseconds, and tick marks are placed on appropriate values like full hours or days. In a category axis, the point names of the chart's series are used for categories, if not a categories array is defined.

options.title: unselect
options.name: plotOptions-series-point-events--unselect
options.description: Fires when the point is unselected either programmatically or following a click on the point. The this keyword refers to the point object itself. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. Returning false cancels the operation.

options.title: upColor
options.name: plotOptions-waterfall--upColor
options.description: The color used specifically for positive point columns. When not specified, the general series color is used.

options.title: update
options.name: plotOptions-series-point-events--update
options.description: Fires when the point is updated programmatically through the .update() method. The this keyword refers to the point object itself. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. The new point options can be accessed through event.options. Returning false cancels the operation.

options.title: url
options.name: exporting--url
options.description: The URL for the server module converting the SVG string to an image format. By default this points to Highslide Software's free web service.

options.title: useHTML
options.name: legend--useHTML
options.description: Whether to use HTML to render the legend item texts. When using HTML, legend.navigation is disabled.

options.title: useHTML
options.name: subtitle--useHTML
options.description: Whether to use HTML to render the text.

options.title: useHTML
options.name: title--useHTML
options.description: Whether to use HTML to render the text.

options.title: useHTML
options.name: xAxis-labels--useHTML
options.description: Whether to use HTML to render the labels.

options.title: useHTML
options.name: xAxis-plotBands-label--useHTML
options.description: Whether to use HTML to render the labels.

options.title: useHTML
options.name: xAxis-plotLines-label--useHTML
options.description: Whether to use HTML to render the labels.

options.title: useHTML
options.name: yAxis-stackLabels--useHTML
options.description: Whether to use HTML to render the labels.

options.title: useHTML
options.demo: A table for value alignment. Full HTML tooltip.
options.name: tooltip--useHTML
options.description: Use HTML to render the contents of the tooltip instead of SVG. Using HTML allows advanced formatting like tables and images in the tooltip. It is also recommended for rtl languages as it works around rtl bugs in early Firefox.

options.title: useUTC
options.demo: True by default - the starting point which is at 00:00 UTC, is displayed as 00:00 in the axis labels and in the tooltip. False - the starting point which is at 00:00 UTC, is displayed as your local browser time in the axis labels and in the tooltip.
options.name: global--useUTC
options.description: Whether to use UTC time for axis scaling, tickmark placement and time display in Highcharts.dateFormat. Advantages of using UTC is that the time displays equally regardless of the user agent's time zone settings. Local time can be used when the data is loaded in real time or when correct Daylight Saving Time transitions are required.

options.title: value

options.name: xAxis-plotLines--value
options.description: The position of the line in axis units.

options.title: valueDecimals
options.demo: Set decimals, prefix and suffix for the value
options.name: tooltip--valueDecimals
options.description: How many decimals to show in each series' y value. This is overridable in each series' tooltip options object. The default is to preserve all decimals.

options.title: valuePrefix
options.demo: Set decimals, prefix and suffix for the value
options.name: tooltip--valuePrefix
options.description: A string to prepend to each series' y value. Overridable in each series' tooltip options object.

options.title: valueSuffix
options.demo: Set decimals, prefix and suffix for the value
options.name: tooltip--valueSuffix
options.description: A string to append to each series' y value. Overridable in each series' tooltip options object.

options.title: verticalAlign

options.name: legend--verticalAlign

options.title: verticalAlign

options.name: title--verticalAlign
options.description: The vertical alignment of the title. Can be one of "top", "middle" and "bottom". When a value is given, the title behaves as floating.

options.title: verticalAlign
options.name: xAxis-plotBands-label--verticalAlign

options.title: verticalAlign
options.name: xAxis-plotLines-label--verticalAlign
options.description: Vertical alignment of the label relative to the plot band. Can be one of "top", "middle" or "bottom".

options.title: verticalAlign
options.demo: "Vertically aligned top", "Vertically aligned middle", "Vertically aligned bottom"
options.name: yAxis-stackLabels--verticalAlign
options.description: Defines the vertical alignment of the stack total label. Can be one of "top", "middle" or "bottom". The default value is calculated at runtime and depends on orientation and whether the stack is positive or negative.

options.title: viewDistance
options.name: chart-options3d--viewDistance
options.description:
Defines the distance the viewer is standing in front of the chart, this setting is important to calculate the perspective effect in column and scatter charts.
It is not used for 3D pie charts.

options.title: visible
options.demo: Two series, one hidden and one visible
options.name: plotOptions-series--visible
options.description: Set the initial visibility of the series.

options.title: waterfall
options.name: plotOptions-waterfall
options.description: Options for the waterfall series type.

options.title: weekdays
options.name: lang--weekdays
options.description: An array containing the weekday names.

options.title: whiskerColor
options.name: plotOptions-boxplot--whiskerColor
options.description: The color of the whiskers, the horizontal lines marking low and high values. When null, the general series color is used.

options.title: whiskerLength
options.name: plotOptions-boxplot--whiskerLength
options.description: The length of the whiskers, the horizontal lines marking low and high values. It can be a numerical pixel value, or a percentage value of the box width. Set 0 to disable whiskers.

options.title: whiskerWidth
options.name: plotOptions-boxplot--whiskerWidth
options.description: The line width of the whiskers, the horizontal lines marking low and high values. When null, the general lineWidth applies.

options.title: whiskerWidth
options.name: plotOptions-errorbar--whiskerWidth
options.description: The line width of the whiskers, the horizontal lines marking low and high values. When null, the general lineWidth applies.

options.title: width
options.name: chart--width
options.description: An explicit width for the chart. By default the width is calculated from the offset width of the containing element.

options.title: width
options.name: exporting--width
options.description: The pixel width of charts exported to PNG or JPG. As of Highcharts 3.0, the default pixel width is a function of the chart.width or exporting.sourceWidth and the exporting.scale.

options.title: width
options.name: legend--width
options.description: The width of the legend box.

options.title: width
options.name: navigation-buttonOptions--width
options.description: The pixel width of the button.

options.title: width
options.name: plotOptions-funnel--width
options.description: The width of the funnel compared to the width of the plot area, or the pixel width if it is a number.

options.title: width
options.demo: 2px wide line from X axis
options.name: xAxis-plotLines--width
options.description: The width or thickness of the plot line.

options.title: wrap
options.name: plotOptions-gauge--wrap
options.description: When this option is true, the dial will wrap around the axes. For instance, in a full-range gauge going from 0 to 360, a value of 400 will point to 40. When wrap is false, the dial stops at 360.

options.title: x

options.title: x
options.name: plotOptions-bar-dataLabels--x
options.description: The x position of the data label relative to the data point.

options.title: x
options.name: plotOptions-series-dataLabels--x
options.description: The x position offset of the label relative to the point.

options.title: x
options.name: series-data--x
options.description: The x value of the point.

options.title: x
options.demo: Footnote at right of plot area
options.name: subtitle--x
options.description: The x position of the subtitle relative to the alignment within chart.spacingLeft and chart.spacingRight.

options.title: x
options.demo: Aligned to the plot area (x = 70px = margin left - spacing left)
options.name: title--x
options.description: The x position of the title relative to the alignment within chart.spacingLeft and chart.spacingRight.

options.title: x
options.demo: Y axis labels placed on grid lines
options.name: xAxis-labels--x
options.description: The x position offset of the label relative to the tick position on the axis.

options.title: x
options.name: xAxis-plotBands-label--x
options.description: Horizontal position relative the alignment. Default varies by orientation.

options.title: x
options.name: xAxis-plotLines-label--x
options.description: Horizontal position relative the alignment. Default varies by orientation.

options.title: x

options.name: yAxis-stackLabels--x
options.description: The x position offset of the label relative to the left of the stacked bar. The default value is calculated at runtime and depends on orientation and whether the stack is positive or negative.

options.title: x
options.demo: Y axis labels placed on grid lines
options.name: yAxis-labels--x
options.description: The x position offset of the label relative to the tick position on the axis. Defaults to -15 for left axis, 15 for right axis.

options.title: xAxis
options.name: series--xAxis
options.description: When using dual or multiple x axes, this number defines which xAxis the particular series is connected to. It refers to either the axis id or the index of the axis in the xAxis array, with 0 being the first.

The X axis or category axis. Normally this is the horizontal axis, though if the chart is inverted this is the vertical axis. In case of multiple axes, the xAxis node is an array of configuration objects.

See the Axis object for programmatic access to the axis.

options.title: xDateFormat

options.title: y

options.title: y

options.title: y

options.title: y
options.name: xAxis-plotLines-label--y
options.description: Vertical position of the text baseline relative to the alignment. Default varies by orientation.

options.title: y
options.demo: Y axis labels placed on grid lines
options.name: yAxis-labels--y
options.description: The y position offset of the label relative to the tick position on the axis.

options.title: y
options.demo: Stack total labels with y offset
options.name: yAxis-stackLabels--y
options.description: The y position offset of the label relative to the tick position on the axis. The default value is calculated at runtime and depends on orientation and whether  the stack is positive or negative.

options.title: y

options.description: The y position offset of the label relative to the tick position on the axis. The default makes it adapt to the font size on bottom axis.

options.title: yAxis

options.name: series--yAxis
options.description: When using dual or multiple y axes, this number defines which yAxis the particular series is connected to. It refers to either the axis id or the index of the axis in the yAxis array, with 0 being the first.

options.title: yAxis
options.name: yAxis
options.description:
The Y axis or value axis. Normally this is the vertical axis, though if the chart is inverted this is the horizontal axis. In case of multiple axes, the yAxis node is an array of configuration objects.

See the Axis object for programmatic access to the axis.

options.title: yHigh
options.name: plotOptions-arearange-dataLabels--yHigh
options.description: Y offset of the higher data labels relative to the point value.

options.title: yLow
options.name: plotOptions-arearange-dataLabels--yLow
options.description: Y offset of the lower data labels relative to the point value.

options.title: zIndex

options.title: zIndex

options.title: zIndex
options.demo: With no z index, the series defined last are on top, with a z index, the series with the highest z index is on top.
options.name: series--zIndex
options.description: Define the visual z index of the series.

options.title: zIndex
options.name: xAxis-labels--zIndex
options.description: The Z index for the axis labels.

options.title: zIndex
options.demo: Behind plot lines by default, above plot lines, above plot lines and series.
options.name: xAxis-plotBands--zIndex
options.description: The z index of the plot band within the chart.

options.title: zIndex
options.demo: Behind plot lines by default, above plot lines, above plot lines and series.
options.name: xAxis-plotLines--zIndex
options.description: The z index of the plot line within the chart.

options.title: zMax
options.demo: Z has a possible range of 0-100
options.name: plotOptions-bubble--zMax
options.description: The minimum for the Z value range. Defaults to the highest Z value in the data.

options.title: zMin
options.demo: Z has a possible range of 0-100
options.name: plotOptions-bubble--zMin
options.description: The minimum for the Z value range. Defaults to the lowest Z value in the data.

options.title: zThreshold
options.name: plotOptions-bubble--zThreshold
options.description: When displayNegative is false, bubbles with lower Z values are skipped. When displayNegative is true and a negativeColor is given, points with lower Z is colored.

options.title: zoomType
options.demo: None by default, x, y, xy
options.name: chart--zoomType
options.description: Decides in what dimensions the user can zoom by dragging the mouse. Can be one of x, y or xy.
